TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable PeerContact extends System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.Peer implements class System.IEquatable`1<class System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact>, class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

Docs.summary: Represents a peer for which a user has retrieved extended information.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A contact represents a trusted peer. A PeerContact object must be created for a remote peer or <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe> for a user to collaborate with the remote peer when it is outside of the "People Near Me" scope. A PeerContact object can exist as either an application running on a remote computer, or the user of a remote computer. An instance of this class can be added to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager> which stores the contact information in a persistent manner.
An application invitation from a PeerContact is both authenticated and encrypted. The UI dialog to accept or reject an invitation from a peer contact also indicates that that the inviter is trusted.
Subscribing to a PeerContact object means a remote peer can see its registered applications, objects and presence information. To subscribe to a PeerContact, the caller must be signed in to the peer collaboration infrastructure via <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration.SignIn%2A> or signed in via the Windows UI. All other operations do not require sign-in.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A display name may be used to differentiate contacts in a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager> in instances where a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> may have multiple email addresses, or if there are multiple peers with the same display name.

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources and optionally releases the managed resources used by the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> leaves a collaboration session, certain objects are no longer required. If this contact had been collaborating with any other endpoint(s) not directly registered with the peer host, and the host expects to continue to collaborate with them, the host must register those endpoints within an application or within its <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager> before disposing of this <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> object.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the email address associated with the .
Docs.value: object that contains the email address associated with the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Net.Mail.MailAddress> object is used to represent the mail address. The Contact Manager allows for multiple email addresses within one instance. The default value for this property is `null`.

Docs.summary: Retrieves the objects that were registered by the remote peer into the local cache.
Docs.returns: The from the local cache. If associated applications are not found for the , a collection of size zero (0) is returned.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the calling peer is not subscribed to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> associated with the specified <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData%2A> method must be called prior to calling this method.
While the caller is not required to sign-in to the collaboration infrastructure for this method to complete successfully, a successful call to <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData%2A> or one of the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe%2A> methods must have been completed while the caller was previously signed in.
This functionality is only exposed on the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> class. This functionality is not exposed on any other type of peer for security reasons.

Docs.exception:
- The calling peer is not subscribed to the .
- The calling peer has not yet called the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse Invite() cil managed

Docs.summary: Sends an invitation to join into peer collaboration sponsored by the sender.
Docs.returns: A from the peer who received the invitation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The caller is not required to sign-in to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration> infrastructure for this method to complete successfully. A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse> from the invitee is not the same as the invitee accepting the invitation to collaborate. If an invitation is sent to a remote peer that has not installed the application, the invitation is automatically declined.

Docs.exception: The <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Id%2A> for the current application does not exist.

A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse> from the invitee is not the same as the invitee accepting the invitation to collaborate. Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying whether the current is subscribed or unsubscribed to an endpoint. Alternatively, this property gets or sets a value specifying whether the current peer host or hosting application has subscribed or unsubscribed to this .
Docs.value: if this is subscribed to this endpoint, if the contact has not subscribed or has unsubscribed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In many instances, a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> is not the same as a peer host. A peer host has an instance within the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager> of the remote peer, and the relationship is that they have invited the peer to collaborate. An endpoint has a "Me" instance within its own contact manager and the peer host, but the relationship is not specified.
If the peer host is in the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager>, and the peer contact chooses not to <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe%2A>, its <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.SubscriptionType> can have a value of blocked, rather than deleting its entry from the host Contact Manager.
There is a many-to-many relationship between local peers, remote peers, peer hosts, and subscriptions. Subscriptions are per user, rather than per process, per application, or per domain. Consequently, the subscriptions associated with a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> object are the list of contacts to which it has subscribed and from which it expects updates. Those contacts either have updated their own application, object, and presence information, or they have updated information regarding contacts in the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager>.
This property always returns `true` if the object is a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> which represents the local or "Me" contact, since a contact is always subscribed to itself.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a string which represents the of the .
Docs.value: <xref:System.String> which represents the nickname of the . The default value for this property is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A Nickname can be used for a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> object in case there are multiple peers with the same display name. A collaboration session can also use the nickname to designate remote peers commonly used in larger collaboration efforts.

Docs.summary: This event is signaled whenever a associated with the has changed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState>. This state is created when the peer collaboration session begins.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnApplicationChanged(class System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ApplicationChangedEventArgs appChangedArgs) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to be passed to delegates associated with the event.
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Application changes occur when an application is launched, registered or unregistered from the collaboration infrastructure. They also occur when peers join or leave a collaboration session or change network endpoint locations. Peer scope changes may also effect a change in an application.
Classes that inherit from this class can override this method to perform additional tasks when the event occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnObjectChanged(class System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ObjectChangedEventArgs objChangedArgs) cil managed

Docs.param: Type of object change specified by .
Docs.summary: Raises the event when a is added, updated or removed by a remote peer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnPresenceChanged(class System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PresenceChangedEventArgs presenceChangedArgs) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to be passed to delegates associated with the event.
Docs.summary: Raises the event when the of a peer has changed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Presence changes occur when a peer signs out of an application, an application is registered or unregistered from the collaboration infrastructure, or a peer unsubscribes from a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> or <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void OnSubscribeCompleted(class System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.SubscribeCompletedEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: The or object associated with the event.
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Classes that inherit from this class can override this method to perform additional tasks when the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.SubscribeCompleted> event occurs.

Docs.summary: Gets the associated with this .
Docs.value: The collection associated with this . The default value for this property is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Whether a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> is a local peer, remote peer, or host peer for the peer contact represented by this instance is not relevant to the presence of the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> in either the endpoint <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPointCollection> or the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager>.
## Examples The following code example illustrates the proper usage of the PeerEndPoints property:
[!code-cs[NCLPNRPContacts#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.net.peertopeer._1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the associated with the .
Docs.value: <xref:System.String> which represents the of the . Unless explicitly specified, the default value for all properties is for reference types.

remarks.format: ## Remarks No two contacts in the address book can have the same <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerName>.

Docs.summary: This event is raised whenever the has changed its presence status.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Subscribe() cil managed

Docs.summary: Subscribes the calling peer to the , and as a result, the peer will receive any future events associated with the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> updates occur asynchronously after the Subscribe method has succeeded. As a result, it is possible for a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> to be added to the collection of a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> before the associated <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint.Name%2A> is provided.
To monitor these changes, it is recommended that the user subscribe to the relevant events; for example, <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint.NameChanged>.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState>. This state is created when the peer collaboration session begins.

Docs.exception: The calling peer is not signed in to People Near Me.
Unable to complete Subscribe operation. Failure may be due to an inability to establish a TCP connection to the peer.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the is exposed to the collaboration events associated with the peer or application that has ownership of the in which this object resides.
Docs.value: enumeration value that specifies whether this is exposed to collaboration events belonging to the peer host or hosting application. Unless explicitly specified, the default value for all properties is for reference types.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property to <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.SubscriptionType>means the remote peer specified by this <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> can see the registered applications, objects and presence information for the user or application that owns the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager> in which this <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> object resides.
This property has no effect on a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> instance that represents the local or "Me" contact, since a contact is always subscribed to itself.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SubscribeAsync(object userToken) cil managed

Docs.param: A user-defined <xref:System.Object> that contains information about the SubscribeAsync operation.
Docs.summary: Asynchronously subscribes the calling peer to the , and as a result, the peer will receive any future events associated with the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.SubscribeCompleted> event is raised upon completion of this operation. If collaboration activities are not required to be asynchronous, the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe%2A> method should be used instead.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState>. This state is created when the peer collaboration session begins.

Docs.exception: The calling peer is not signed in to People Near Me.

Docs.summary: Raised when a subscription operation has completed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When this event is raised, the error property on the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.SubscribeCompletedEventArgs> object should be examined to determine whether the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.SubscribeAsync%2A> process completed successfully.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState>. This state is created when the peer collaboration session begins.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable.GetObjectData(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: Holds the serialized data associated with the object.
Contains the destination for the serialized stream associated with the object.
Docs.summary: Implements the interface and returns the data needed to serialize the instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string ToXml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Serializes the to an XML string for persistent storage or network transfer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Unsubscribe() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes a subscription to the and as a result the calling peer no longer receives events associated with the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the calling peer is not subscribed to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> specified the result is a no-op. A calling peer can verify whether it is subscribed to events for the peer identified by this instance with the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.IsSubscribed%2A> property.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState>. This state is created when the peer collaboration session begins.
